welcomeStep.title: Thanks for using Godot Launcher!
welcomeStep.description: Godot Launcher makes it easy to manage multiple versions of the Godot Engine and keeps editor settings separate for each project.
welcomeStep.feedback: By using it, you're helping to support the project! If you ever have feedback or find a bug, let us know, we'd love to make it even better for you.

startStep.title: You're All Set! ðŸš€
startStep.subtitle: Godot Launcher is ready to go! You can now manage your projects and explore all the features.
startStep.installTab: Install and experiment with the latest prereleases in the Install tab.
startStep.projectsTab: Quickly add or create projects in the Projects tab.
startStep.settingsTab: Customize your experience just the way you like in the Settings tab.

macosStep.title: macOS Note
macosStep.intro: The Godot Launcher creates a copy of the editor for each project.
macosStep.reason: Creating symbolic links on macOS is not restricted by permissions, but opening the editor through a symlink has proven to be unreliable. To ensure a smooth experience, we provide a dedicated copy of the engine for each project instead. While Godot is only around 200MB (and this is generally not a problem) be aware that multiple projects can lead to increased disk usage.
macosStep.dotnetNote: NOTE: If you are working with .NET Editors, you will need to install the .NET SDK from <ButtonLink>Microsoft .NET website</ButtonLink> <Icon />

windowsStep.title: Windows Note
windowsStep.intro: Starting from version 1.4.0, Godot Launcher can create symlinks to the editor for each project. To keep setup simple, we now default to local copies. You can enable symlinks anytime from Settings â†’ Behavior â†’ Editor symlinks when you want lower disk usage.
windowsStep.change1: Creating symbolic links on Windows requires administrator privileges and elevated command execution. The launcher now elevates permissions only when creating symlinks.
windowsStep.change2: You will see a UAC prompt only if you are not an Administrator on your PC and if Developer Mode is not enabled.
windowsStep.change3: Ready to try symlinks? Toggle on Editor symlinks in Settings when you're prepared for the occasional elevation prompt.
windowsStep.dotnetNote: NOTE: If you are using .NET-based editors, you need to install the .NET SDK from <ButtonLink>Microsoft .NET website</ButtonLink> <Icon />

linuxStep.title: Linux Note
linuxStep.intro: Godot Launcher uses symbolic links for each project
linuxStep.reason: Unlike Windows and MacOS version, Linux uses symbolic links to the editor to launch projects. This saves disk space and allows for per project settings.
linuxStep.dotnetNote: NOTE: If you are working with .NET Editors, you will need to install the .NET SDK from <ButtonLink>Microsoft .NET website</ButtonLink> <Icon />
